name: places/ChIJtTo6RfbzwokR6wO1de0J7Yw
formattedAddress: 570 W 207th St, New York, NY 10034, USA
adrFormatAddress: 570 W 207th St, New York, NY 10034, USA

originalText.text:
My account was compromised, and I was advised by the 800 phone service rep to go into a branch immediately to sort it out.

When I got there the ATM was packed, many people mask-less and coughing, no security. By the way, clients have to go through the ATM vestibule to get into the bank.

Next: Through the main doors doors, there was an empty waiting area, but you could see glass offices had bankers/managers inside. I told a very young girl that my acct might have been compromised and could be a fraud case, and she told me to have a seat. After 10 mins she returned and said: “Sorry everyone is busy, they have back to back appointments, and nobody is available to speak with you.” I asked if I should wait, or could I make an appt? She said no, but I could come back if I wanted to. I told her I would never be back as I left, completely defeated and outraged.

My point is this: not one manager nor banker had 30 secs to acknowledge my situation nor my very serious concern! It was on the advice of a Chase phone rep that I had gone into the branch (during the beginning of the pandemic) in the first place. The people at this branch, from the top down, need to be re-trained on professional courtesy.

I would give negative stars/rating if I could.

originalText.text: Ms Yasmin dilsa was so helpful and professional. And was attentive to all entering the bank. She made my situation an easy task. She made sure each person was greeted and helped them immediately.

text.text: Ms Yasmin dilsa was so helpful and professional. And was attentive to all entering the bank. She made my situation an easy task. She made sure each person was greeted and helped them immediately.

originalText.text: I have to say that I'm disappointed that with all the bad reviews this bank branch has not been able to address the shortage of staff issue.  I typically stand on line for a roll of quarter if I forget to pick up downtown about 20 to 30 minutes.  This is unacceptable for a Chase Branch.  I asked them to increase staff especially on Saturday and they looked at me like I had ten heads.  I opened an account at Citi just so I can get quarter.  They are nicer and the lines are shorter.  I did state that if this was in the Financial District this would never happen!  I call it subtle profiling of the neighborhoods.

originalText.text: The employees at this branch are amazing! They are so helpful. It’s clear that they truly care.

text.text: The employees at this branch are amazing! They are so helpful. It’s clear that they truly care.

originalText.text: I feel sorry that I can’t not give less than one start.. First time at this location using the window. I went to get a money order. Only 2 tellers, there was a client that approached one them very friendly, this customer was there for about 15 minutes, the other teller which I was waiting for, she saw me arriving, she moved away from the window without telling nobody  already in the line ANYTHING . She went to the floor and was talking to a banker, then went back to the teller line , then she moved away again to the back .. all of that without communicating with the customer waiting for her. While the other customer was with the other teller , all the people in the line were complaining and talking about it. She even was drinking a Snapples juice .. when she is not supposed to eat or drink at the window..! When I finally arrived to the window I wasn’t greeted, she didn’t say sorry for the wait .. nothing... she was on silence the whole time. When she finally finish whit my  transaction, she did not even say THANK YOU to me .. ..  I just can’t believed it !! The teller name was yudelky Carrasco .. something like that .. horrible ! She does not have an idea of what customer services should be like ...
